An array of multi-modal inputs to the moderation model.

CreateModerationRequest_model.description:
The content moderation model you would like to use. Learn more in
[the moderation guide](/docs/guides/moderation), and learn about
available models [here](/docs/models#moderation).

CreateModerationResponse_results_inner_c.description: A list of the categories, and whether they are flagged or not.

hate.description: Content that expresses, incites, or promotes hate based on race, gender, ethnicity, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, disability status, or caste. Hateful content aimed at non-protected groups (e.g., chess players) is harassment.

hate/threatening.description: Hateful content that also includes violence or serious harm towards the targeted group based on race, gender, ethnicity, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, disability status, or caste.

harassment.description: Content that expresses, incites, or promotes harassing language towards any target.

harassment/threatening.description: Harassment content that also includes violence or serious harm towards any target.

illicit.description: Content that includes instructions or advice that facilitate the planning or execution of wrongdoing, or that gives advice or instruction on how to commit illicit acts. For example, "how to shoplift" would fit this category.

illicit/violent.description: Content that includes instructions or advice that facilitate the planning or execution of wrongdoing that also includes violence, or that gives advice or instruction on the procurement of any weapon.

self-harm.description: Content that promotes, encourages, or depicts acts of self-harm, such as suicide, cutting, and eating disorders.

self-harm/intent.description: Content where the speaker expresses that they are engaging or intend to engage in acts of self-harm, such as suicide, cutting, and eating disorders.

self-harm/instructions.description: Content that encourages performing acts of self-harm, such as suicide, cutting, and eating disorders, or that gives instructions or advice on how to commit such acts.

sexual.description: Content meant to arouse sexual excitement, such as the description of sexual activity, or that promotes sexual services (excluding sex education and wellness).

sexual/minors.description: Sexual content that includes an individual who is under 18 years old.

violence.description: Content that depicts death, violence, or physical injury.

violence/graphic.description: Content that depicts death, violence, or physical injury in graphic detail.

CreateModerationResponse_results_inner_c.description: A list of the categories along with their scores as predicted by model.
A list of the categories along with the input type(s) that the score applies to.

hate.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'hate'.

hate/threatening.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'hate/threatening'.

harassment.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'harassment'.

harassment/threatening.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'harassment/threatening'.

illicit.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'illicit'.

illicit/violent.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'illicit/violent'.

self-harm.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'self-harm'.

self-harm/intent.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'self-harm/intent'.

self-harm/instructions.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'self-harm/instructions'.

sexual.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'sexual'.

sexual/minors.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'sexual/minors'.

violence.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'violence'.

violence/graphic.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'violence/graphic'.

flagged.description: Whether any of the below categories are flagged.

CreateRunRequest_model.description: The ID of the [Model](/docs/api-reference/models) to be used to execute this run. If a value is provided here, it will override the model associated with the assistant. If not, the model associated with the assistant will be used.

CreateSpeechRequest_model.description: One of the available [TTS models](/docs/models#tts): `tts-1` or `tts-1-hd`

CreateThreadAndRunRequest_tool_resources.description: A set of resources that are used by the assistant's tools. The resources are specific to the type of tool. For example, the `code_interpreter` tool requires a list of file IDs, while the `file_search` tool requires a list of vector store IDs.

file_ids.description: A list of [file](/docs/api-reference/files) IDs to add to the vector store. There can be a maximum of 10000 files in a vector store.

metadata.description: Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to a vector store. This can be useful for storing additional information about the vector store in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long.

vector_store_ids.description: The [vector store](/docs/api-reference/vector-stores/object) attached to this thread. There can be a maximum of 1 vector store attached to the thread.

vector_stores.description: A helper to create a [vector store](/docs/api-reference/vector-stores/object) with file_ids and attach it to this thread. There can be a maximum of 1 vector store attached to the thread.

CreateThreadRequest_tool_resources.description: A set of resources that are made available to the assistant's tools in this thread. The resources are specific to the type of tool. For example, the `code_interpreter` tool requires a list of file IDs, while the `file_search` tool requires a list of vector store IDs.

CreateTranscriptionRequest_model.description: ID of the model to use. Only `whisper-1` (which is powered by our open source Whisper V2 model) is currently available.

CreateVectorStoreRequest_chunking_strate.description: The chunking strategy used to chunk the file(s). If not set, will use the `auto` strategy. Only applicable if `file_ids` is non-empty.

FineTuneDPOMethod_hyperparameters_beta.description: The beta value for the DPO method. A higher beta value will increase the weight of the penalty between the policy and reference model.

FineTuneDPOMethod_hyperparameters_batch_.description: Number of examples in each batch. A larger batch size means that model parameters are updated less frequently, but with lower variance.

FineTuneDPOMethod_hyperparameters_learni.description: Scaling factor for the learning rate. A smaller learning rate may be useful to avoid overfitting.

FineTuneDPOMethod_hyperparameters_n_epoc.description: The number of epochs to train the model for. An epoch refers to one full cycle through the training dataset.

FineTuneDPOMethod_hyperparameters.description: The hyperparameters used for the fine-tuning job.

tools.description: A list of tools the model may generate JSON inputs for.

parallel_tool_calls.description: Whether to enable [parallel function calling](/docs/guides/function-calling#configuring-parallel-function-calling) during tool use.

FineTuningJob_error.description: For fine-tuning jobs that have `failed`, this will contain more information on the cause of the failure.

param.description: The parameter that was invalid, usually `training_file` or `validation_file`. This field will be null if the failure was not parameter-specific.

FineTuningJob_hyperparameters.description: The hyperparameters used for the fine-tuning job. This value will only be returned when running `supervised` jobs.

FineTuningJobCheckpoint_metrics.description: Metrics at the step number during the fine-tuning job.

For example, the `code_interpreter` tool requires a list of file IDs, while the `file_search` tool requires a list of vector store IDs.

PredictionContent_content.description:
The content that should be matched when generating a model response.
If generated tokens would match this content, the entire model response
can be returned much more quickly.

oneOf.description:
The content used for a Predicted Output. This is often the
text of a file you are regenerating with minor changes.
oneOf.title: Text content

oneOf.description: An array of content parts with a defined type. Supported options differ based on the [model](/docs/models) being used to generate the response. Can contain text inputs.
oneOf.title: Array of content parts

text.description: The text content, used for `input_text` and `text` content types.

id.description:
ID of a previous conversation item to reference (for `item_reference`
content types in `response.create` events). These can reference both
client and server created items.

audio.description: Base64-encoded audio bytes, used for `input_audio` content type.

transcript.description: The transcript of the audio, used for `input_audio` content type.

RealtimeResponse_status_details_error.description:
A description of the error that caused the response to fail, 
populated when the `status` is `failed`.

type.description:
The type of error that caused the response to fail, corresponding 
with the `status` field (`completed`, `cancelled`, `incomplete`, 
`failed`).

reason.description:
The reason the Response did not complete. For a `cancelled` Response, 
one of `turn_detected` (the server VAD detected a new start of speech) 
or `client_cancelled` (the client sent a cancel event). For an 
`incomplete` Response, one of `max_output_tokens` or `content_filter` 
(the server-side safety filter activated and cut off the response).

RealtimeResponse_usage_input_token_detai.description: Details about the input tokens used in the Response.

cached_tokens.description: The number of cached tokens used in the Response.

text_tokens.description: The number of text tokens used in the Response.

audio_tokens.description: The number of audio tokens used in the Response.

RealtimeResponse_usage_output_token_deta.description: Details about the output tokens used in the Response.

text_tokens.description: The number of text tokens used in the Response.

audio_tokens.description: The number of audio tokens used in the Response.

RealtimeResponse_usage.description:
Usage statistics for the Response, this will correspond to billing. A 
Realtime API session will maintain a conversation context and append new 
Items to the Conversation, thus output from previous turns (text and 
audio tokens) will become the input for later turns.

total_tokens.description:
The total number of tokens in the Response including input and output 
text and audio tokens.

input_tokens.description:
The number of input tokens used in the Response, including text and 
audio tokens.

output_tokens.description:
The number of output tokens sent in the Response, including text and 
audio tokens.

type.description: The type of the tool, i.e. `function`.

name.description: The name of the function.

description.description:
The description of the function, including guidance on when and how 
to call it, and guidance about what to tell the user when calling 
(if anything).

parameters.description: Parameters of the function in JSON Schema.

RealtimeResponseCreateParams_max_respons.description:
Maximum number of output tokens for a single assistant response,
inclusive of tool calls. Provide an integer between 1 and 4096 to
limit output tokens, or `inf` for the maximum available tokens for a
given model. Defaults to `inf`.

RealtimeResponseCreateParams_conversatio.description:
Controls which conversation the response is added to. Currently supports
`auto` and `none`, with `auto` as the default value. The `auto` value
means that the contents of the response will be added to the default
conversation. Set this to `none` to create an out-of-band response which 
will not add items to default conversation.

id.description: The unique ID of the conversation.

object.description: The object type, must be `realtime.conversation`.

param.description: Parameter related to the error, if any.
Parameter related to the error, if any.

event_id.description: The event_id of the client event that caused the error, if applicable.

name.description: The name of the rate limit (`requests`, `tokens`).

limit.description: The maximum allowed value for the rate limit.

remaining.description: The remaining value before the limit is reached.

reset_seconds.description: Seconds until the rate limit resets.

RealtimeServerEventResponseContentPartAd.description: The content part that was added.

transcript.description: The transcript of the audio (if type is "audio").

RealtimeServerEventResponseContentPartDo.description: The content part that is done.

transcript.description: The transcript of the audio (if type is "audio").

RealtimeSession_model.description: The Realtime model used for this session.

RealtimeSession_input_audio_transcriptio.description:
Configuration for input audio transcription, defaults to off and can be 
set to `null` to turn off once on. Input audio transcription is not native 
to the model, since the model consumes audio directly. Transcription runs 
asynchronously through Whisper and should be treated as rough guidance 
rather than the representation understood by the model.

model.description:
The model to use for transcription, `whisper-1` is the only currently 
supported model.

RealtimeSession_turn_detection.description:
Configuration for turn detection. Can be set to `null` to turn off. Server 
VAD means that the model will detect the start and end of speech based on 
audio volume and respond at the end of user speech.

type.description: Type of turn detection, only `server_vad` is currently supported.

threshold.description:
Activation threshold for VAD (0.0 to 1.0), this defaults to 0.5. A 
higher threshold will require louder audio to activate the model, and 
thus might perform better in noisy environments.

prefix_padding_ms.description:
Amount of audio to include before the VAD detected speech (in 
milliseconds). Defaults to 300ms.

silence_duration_ms.description:
Duration of silence to detect speech stop (in milliseconds). Defaults 
to 500ms. With shorter values the model will respond more quickly, 
but may jump in on short pauses from the user.

RealtimeSessionCreateRequest_turn_detect.description:
Configuration for turn detection. Can be set to `null` to turn off. Server 
VAD means that the model will detect the start and end of speech based on 
audio volume and respond at the end of user speech.

type.description: Type of turn detection, only `server_vad` is currently supported.

threshold.description:
Activation threshold for VAD (0.0 to 1.0), this defaults to 0.5. A 
higher threshold will require louder audio to activate the model, and 
thus might perform better in noisy environments.

prefix_padding_ms.description:
Amount of audio to include before the VAD detected speech (in 
milliseconds). Defaults to 300ms.

silence_duration_ms.description:
Duration of silence to detect speech stop (in milliseconds). Defaults 
to 500ms. With shorter values the model will respond more quickly, 
but may jump in on short pauses from the user.

create_response.description:
Whether or not to automatically generate a response when VAD is
enabled. `true` by default.

RealtimeSessionCreateResponse_client_sec.description: Ephemeral key returned by the API.

value.description:
Ephemeral key usable in client environments to authenticate connections
to the Realtime API. Use this in client-side environments rather than
a standard API token, which should only be used server-side.

expires_at.description:
Timestamp for when the token expires. Currently, all tokens expire
after one minute.

RealtimeSessionCreateResponse_turn_detec.description:
Configuration for turn detection. Can be set to `null` to turn off. Server 
VAD means that the model will detect the start and end of speech based on 
audio volume and respond at the end of user speech.

type.description: Type of turn detection, only `server_vad` is currently supported.

threshold.description:
Activation threshold for VAD (0.0 to 1.0), this defaults to 0.5. A 
higher threshold will require louder audio to activate the model, and 
thus might perform better in noisy environments.

prefix_padding_ms.description:
Amount of audio to include before the VAD detected speech (in 
milliseconds). Defaults to 300ms.

silence_duration_ms.description:
Duration of silence to detect speech stop (in milliseconds). Defaults 
to 500ms. With shorter values the model will respond more quickly, 
but may jump in on short pauses from the user.

description.description: A description of what the response format is for, used by the model to determine how to respond in the format.

name.description: The name of the response format. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

schema.description: The schema for the response format, described as a JSON Schema object.

strict.description: Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the output. If set to true, the model will always follow the exact schema defined in the `schema` field. Only a subset of JSON Schema is supported when `strict` is `true`. To learn more, read the [Structured Outputs guide](/docs/guides/structured-outputs).

RunStepObject_last_error.description: The last error associated with this run step. Will be `null` if there are no errors.

message.description: A human-readable description of the error.

RunStepStreamEvent_oneOf_1.description: Occurs when a [run step](/docs/api-reference/run-steps/step-object) moves to an `in_progress` state.

RunStepStreamEvent_oneOf_2.description: Occurs when parts of a [run step](/docs/api-reference/run-steps/step-object) are being streamed.

RunStreamEvent_oneOf.description: Occurs when a new [run](/docs/api-reference/runs/object) is created.

RunStreamEvent_oneOf_1.description: Occurs when a [run](/docs/api-reference/runs/object) moves to a `queued` status.

RunStreamEvent_oneOf_2.description: Occurs when a [run](/docs/api-reference/runs/object) moves to an `in_progress` status.

RunStreamEvent_oneOf_3.description: Occurs when a [run](/docs/api-reference/runs/object) moves to a `requires_action` status.

RunStreamEvent_oneOf_5.description: Occurs when a [run](/docs/api-reference/runs/object) ends with status `incomplete`.

RunStreamEvent_oneOf_7.description: Occurs when a [run](/docs/api-reference/runs/object) moves to a `cancelling` status.

name.description: The name of the function.

arguments.description: The arguments that the model expects you to pass to the function.

tool_call_id.description: The ID of the tool call in the `required_action` object within the run object the output is being submitted for.

output.description: The output of the tool call to be submitted to continue the run.

in_progress.description: The number of files that are currently being processed.

completed.description: The number of files that have been processed.

failed.description: The number of files that have failed to process.

cancelled.description: The number of files that where cancelled.

VectorStoreFileObject_last_error.description: The last error associated with this vector store file. Will be `null` if there are no errors.

message.description: A human-readable description of the error.

VectorStoreFileObject_chunking_strategy.description: The strategy used to chunk the file.

in_progress.description: The number of files that are currently being processed.

completed.description: The number of files that have been successfully processed.

failed.description: The number of files that have failed to process.

cancelled.description: The number of files that were cancelled.

groups.title: Audio
groups.description:
Learn how to turn audio into text or text into audio.

Related guide: [Speech to text](/docs/guides/speech-to-text)

groups.title: Chat
groups.description:
Given a list of messages comprising a conversation, the model will return a response.
Related guide: [Chat Completions](/docs/guides/text-generation)

groups.title: Embeddings
groups.description:
Get a vector representation of a given input that can be easily consumed by machine learning models and algorithms.
Related guide: [Embeddings](/docs/guides/embeddings)

groups.title: Fine-tuning
groups.description:
Manage fine-tuning jobs to tailor a model to your specific training data.
Related guide: [Fine-tune models](/docs/guides/fine-tuning)

groups.title: Batch
groups.description:
Create large batches of API requests for asynchronous processing. The Batch API returns completions within 24 hours for a 50% discount.
Related guide: [Batch](/docs/guides/batch)

groups.title: Files
groups.description: Files are used to upload documents that can be used with features like [Assistants](/docs/api-reference/assistants), [Fine-tuning](/docs/api-reference/fine-tuning), and [Batch API](/docs/guides/batch).

groups.title: Uploads
groups.description: Allows you to upload large files in multiple parts.

groups.title: Images
groups.description:
Given a prompt and/or an input image, the model will generate a new image.
Related guide: [Image generation](/docs/guides/images)

groups.title: Models
groups.description: List and describe the various models available in the API. You can refer to the [Models](/docs/models) documentation to understand what models are available and the differences between them.

groups.title: Moderations
groups.description:
Given text and/or image inputs, classifies if those inputs are potentially harmful across several categories.
Related guide: [Moderations](/docs/guides/moderation)

groups.title: Assistants
groups.description:
Build assistants that can call models and use tools to perform tasks.

[Get started with the Assistants API](/docs/assistants)

groups.title: Threads
groups.description:
Create threads that assistants can interact with.

Related guide: [Assistants](/docs/assistants/overview)

groups.title: Messages
groups.description:
Create messages within threads

Related guide: [Assistants](/docs/assistants/overview)

groups.title: Runs
groups.description:
Represents an execution run on a thread.

Related guide: [Assistants](/docs/assistants/overview)

groups.title: Run steps
groups.description:
Represents the steps (model and tool calls) taken during the run.

Related guide: [Assistants](/docs/assistants/overview)

groups.title: Vector stores
groups.description:
Vector stores are used to store files for use by the `file_search` tool.

Related guide: [File Search](/docs/assistants/tools/file-search)

groups.title: Vector store files
groups.description:
Vector store files represent files inside a vector store.

Related guide: [File Search](/docs/assistants/tools/file-search)

groups.title: Vector store file batches
groups.description:
Vector store file batches represent operations to add multiple files to a vector store.
Related guide: [File Search](/docs/assistants/tools/file-search)

groups.title: Streaming
groups.description:
Stream the result of executing a Run or resuming a Run after submitting tool outputs.
You can stream events from the [Create Thread and Run](/docs/api-reference/runs/createThreadAndRun),
[Create Run](/docs/api-reference/runs/createRun), and [Submit Tool Outputs](/docs/api-reference/runs/submitToolOutputs)
endpoints by passing `"stream": true`. The response will be a [Server-Sent events](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/server-sent-events.html#server-sent-events) stream.
Our Node and Python SDKs provide helpful utilities to make streaming easy. Reference the
[Assistants API quickstart](/docs/assistants/overview) to learn more.

groups.title: Administration
groups.description:
Programmatically manage your organization.
The Audit Logs endpoint provides a log of all actions taken in the organization for security and monitoring purposes.
To access these endpoints please generate an Admin API Key through the [API Platform Organization overview](/organization/admin-keys). Admin API keys cannot be used for non-administration endpoints.
For best practices on setting up your organization, please refer to this [guide](/docs/guides/production-best-practices#setting-up-your-organization)

groups.title: Admin API Keys
groups.description:
The **Usage API** provides detailed insights into your activity across the OpenAI API. It also includes a separate [Costs endpoint](/docs/api-reference/usage/costs), which offers visibility into your spend, breaking down consumption by invoice line items and project IDs.
While the Usage API delivers granular usage data, it may not always reconcile perfectly with the Costs due to minor differences in how usage and spend are recorded. For financial purposes, we recommend using the [Costs endpoint](/docs/api-reference/usage/costs) or the [Costs tab](/settings/organization/usage) in the Usage Dashboard, which will reconcile back to your billing invoice.

groups.title: Invites
groups.description: Invite and manage invitations for an organization.

groups.title: Users
groups.description: Manage users and their role in an organization.

groups.title: Projects
groups.description:
Manage the projects within an orgnanization includes creation, updating, and archiving or projects.
The Default project cannot be archived.

groups.title: Project users
groups.description: Manage users within a project, including adding, updating roles, and removing users.

groups.title: Project service accounts
groups.description:
Manage service accounts within a project. A service account is a bot user that is not associated with a user.
If a user leaves an organization, their keys and membership in projects will no longer work. Service accounts
do not have this limitation. However, service accounts can also be deleted from a project.

groups.title: Project API keys
groups.description:
Manage API keys for a given project. Supports listing and deleting keys for users.
This API does not allow issuing keys for users, as users need to authorize themselves to generate keys.

groups.title: Project rate limits
groups.description: Manage rate limits per model for projects. Rate limits may be configured to be equal to or lower than the organization's rate limits.

groups.title: Audit logs
groups.description:
Logs of user actions and configuration changes within this organization.
To log events, you must activate logging in the [Organization Settings](/settings/organization/general).
Once activated, for security reasons, logging cannot be deactivated.

groups.title: Usage
groups.description:
The **Usage API** provides detailed insights into your activity across the OpenAI API. It also includes a separate [Costs endpoint](/docs/api-reference/usage/costs), which offers visibility into your spend, breaking down consumption by invoice line items and project IDs.

While the Usage API delivers granular usage data, it may not always reconcile perfectly with the Costs due to minor differences in how usage and spend are recorded. For financial purposes, we recommend using the [Costs endpoint](/docs/api-reference/usage/costs) or the [Costs tab](/settings/organization/usage) in the Usage Dashboard, which will reconcile back to your billing invoice.

groups.title: Realtime
groups.description:
Communicate with a GPT-4o class model in real time using WebRTC or 
WebSockets. Supports text and audio inputs and ouputs, along with audio
transcriptions.
[Learn more about the Realtime API](/docs/guides/realtime).

groups.title: Session tokens
groups.description:
REST API endpoint to generate ephemeral session tokens for use in client-side
applications.

groups.title: Client events
groups.description: These are events that the OpenAI Realtime WebSocket server will accept from the client.

groups.title: Server events
groups.description: These are events emitted from the OpenAI Realtime WebSocket server to the client.

groups.title: Completions
groups.description: Given a prompt, the model will return one or more predicted completions along with the probabilities of alternative tokens at each position. Most developer should use our [Chat Completions API](/docs/guides/text-generation#text-generation-models) to leverage our best and newest models.
